revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Compex |model=MMJ342 |revision=Plus |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date=June 2014 |fcc_date= |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=Yes |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=outdoor access point, CPE |fcc_id= |ic_id= |us_id= |pwr_v=24 |pwr_amp=0.5 |pwr_conn= |pwr_poe=ns |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model=AR9342 |cpu1_cspeed=560 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |ram1=64 |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe |expansion_minipcie_num=1 |expansion_usb_num= |jtag=yes |serial=yes |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR9342 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module=Compex WLE200N2-23 |wi2_module_if=Mini PCIe |wi2_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi2_chip1_model=AR9283 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=2 |wan_ports= |addl_chips= |flags=outdoor, hg directional, high power |stock_boot= |stock_os=Linux;;CompexWRT; |tp_firmware=OpenWrt |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=Compex |default_pass=password |oui= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|MiMo Junior Plus series Outdoor Access Point}} :[http://www.compex.com.sg/product/mmj342-plus/ Product page]
This device is an outdoor access point / CPE.
The datasheet would seem to indicate (it's assumed..) it is using an additional :wireless module ([[Compex WLE200N2-23]]) for the 2.4GHz band.
Per '''Compex'''... *It's using the '''QCA''' QCA9342 (clocked @560MHz), :presumably AR9342 (noted as such in the datasheet) *It supports 24V PoE
===Blurb from Compex=== <small>''MMJ342 Plus is a high-performance Outdoor Access Point with integrated PoE. :Using Qualcomm Atheros QCA9342 (560MHz) Processor,'' ''MMJ342 Plus is dual-band high-speed product,it is built-in 17dBi@5GHz dual-polarization antenna :and 7dBi@2.4G patterns for Dipole array antenna, best choice for bridge and coverage application'' ''MMJ342 Plus has been integrated by radio 5GHz to achieve longer range as bride and 2.4Ghz as coverage :The device is powerful, easy to handle, and also used in implementation over long distance by wireless ISP''</small>
